pros: People work well as a team
cons: Management changes often, can be frustrating

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Yakima, WA
pros: Great communication, everyone helps each other, very supportive and friendly staff.
cons: Lack resources for staffing, can be overworked easily if there is a high acuity rate of patience.

pros: Hard-working CNAs. Food service staff do good work. Primary care physicians at community clinics are competent though access is lacking.
cons: Lack of routine employee healthcare services such as an urgent care clinic or availability of expedient lab work. Systematic employee wage theft. Unproductive meetings during designated lunches. No breaks. Poor leadership. Management doesn’t know how to read and interpret data so ultimately ended up losing $18-34 million dollars, which ended local hospital ownership and control. This occurred as employee ratings on Glassdoor trend heavily downwards and most reviews mention issues w/ inept management. Management includes those who have never provided direct patient care and who also lack the business acumen to maintain profitability. Decision-making was so poor many people thought they were driving the hospital into the ground deliberately to expedite the shady Multicare (monopoly) deal.

pros: Benefits. Health ins. Matching 401k
cons: Holidays. Weekends. 24 hours. Busy. Stressful.

pros: Nice People. Nice Environment. The people were warm and inviting
cons: I worked nights. It was very long and boring with nothing to do

pros: Lip service is given to topics such as "cultural competence" and "equity".
cons: If you're darker complected, expect to do more work for less pay than your white coworkers. Expect stricter parameters for policy adherence and possibly surveillance/micromanaging.

pros: Supportive team environment within the care coordination department.
cons: Poor management follow up, poor pay.

pros: I don't have any pros
cons: We are severely overworked and not paid enough. Management treats us terrible and never helps make a difference.

pros: No traffic commute. strong employee health support.
cons: Horrible executive leadership, VP and physician executive, for the outpatient clinics. High turnover in staff and doctors due to this poor leadership. Autocratic and unsupportive.

pros: compensation package is great: CME, Professional society membership, licensing, DEA all covered
cons: administrators, lack of communication from leadership

They will change your schedule to one you weren’t hired for.

pros: Great team of people on the floor

pros: Hospital Leadership - confused and don't know what they are doing.

pros: Decebt benefits if you can afford them

pros: Steady work. No micromanagement. Relaxed environment. Learning potential if you apply yourself.

job_title: Senior Director of Medical Specialties in Yakima, WA
pros: Family support, community-supported. A strong desire to serve the community.
cons: Communication and support of leaders, representation

pros: Normally pay above minimum wage.
cons: holidays are the worst days to work

pros: This is a hospital that encourages all employees to speak up to avoid medical mistakes.  The hospital works well with the community and looks to expand the services for our community.  "Free" health insurance for you, but with a catch.
cons: The maximum raise is 3% if you are an administrative assistant.  Therefore, in ten years, you would be making the same amount.  No paid vacation the first year for the secretarial pool, even if you have lots of experience.  You get "free health care" but you pay $300 to $500 month to add your children or family, so if you are on a secretaries salary, you can't afford to cover your family.

pros: Coworkers are terrific as long as they actually do the work and do not put it all on you. The cafeteria is amazing and the free healthy now clinic was nice.
cons: If you become ill and miss even a few days they will make you feel awful and in the past we had to have special meetings where they threaten your position and make you feel awful, even with documented medical paperwork. For being a healthcare agency I have never experienced such harassment and misunderstandings. Feeling like management or HR do not care and will not stick up for you is an awful experience, especially for an employee that has spent many many years working for your company. I watched many valuable employees with legit medical problems be harassed and then let go. Management can be awful and HR does nothing about it until it's too late and you are gone. I have no trust in the agency.

pros: it provides a quality service to every segment of th population. The employees are all caring individuals and like to help others. The benefits are excellent.  The facilities are first rate. The majority of the staff work together well and are proud (as am I) to be associated with this hospital.
cons: Management does not always walk the talk. Employees are encouraged to think outside the box, but when they do, they often run into managerial roadblocks or discouragement. Employees are encouraged to not be afraid of disagreeing with management, but  I have seen individuals who do get "encouraged" to leave.

review_title: Very stressful employer & management  harassment is allowed by this employer, management & coworkers.
pros: Most pros are long gone.   Most perks have been taken away & replaced by negativity.  Top management does not practice the team work or positive attitude  that they preach.
cons: Most negative employer I have worked for,  I thought health care was centered around making society healthy and helping those who may need it.  For YVMH it's  all about them and their control.

review_title: I always feel appreciated, they are quick to reward excellence, I love it here!
pros: Great benefits, Wonderful managment that are always available to listen and work with you so well because they understand we have families and lives outside of our jobs. They are great with rewarding hard work, and when necessary they are very compassionate and helpful in guiding you to become a better employee rather than "punishment" . The technology is rapidly growing and making Memorial a better and safer place to work and be taken care of!
cons: The employees here do like it (as do I), so that causes very little turn over it seems. This means that there is not a lot of opportunity for advancement unfortunatly.

pros: Progressive, talented physicians and staff good relationships and working collaboration between hospital proper and community practices. Facilities top notch, beautiful.
cons: Yakim WA is a community of only ~80,000 serving area of ~130, 000. Many patients from outlying rural areas. Tend to have limited income. Poorest county in WA State. Better shopping lies outside the community, not far away in Seattle.

pros: Licensed Pharmacy Technician, Really good learning experience, your taught a lot different thing in a lot of different areas of pharmacy inpatient and outpatient
cons: Wages are extremely low for the amount of work expected from you, but they have no trouble coming up with the budget to remodel the entire hospital the technician working at a retail pharmacy made $2.00 more per hour

review_title: Corporate “alignment” makes it impossible to get things done
pros: Non-profit, employee discounts, community- oriented, prominent employer in the community, great employees and departmental teamwork
cons: Recent corporate affiliation and subsequent transition has lowered morale among employees, created confusion about organizational priorities, and has made it hard to get things changed or improved.

pros: Community Hospital that appeared to have a good reputation.  Cafe food is great!  Good on-site child care. Nice and updated facility.
cons: No teamwork!  Middle management was truly caught in the middle!!  No support from Administration.  Constantly belittled by VP.  From the outside it looks like a great place to work, but don't be fooled!  Healthcare nationally is in a CRISES and Memorial is not responding well.  CEO needed to retire 5 years ago.  Staff just put in their time and leave. No heart and sole.

job_title: Magnetic Resonance Technologist in Yakima, WA
pros: Company has alot of opportunities for employees.
cons: Unfortunately this company has been mismanaged for many years.  This company needs to be cleaned up as far as limiting management staff to the needed positions only (very top heavy with VP's and middle management), additionally this company allows and creates a very negative environment.  The HR department does not care about employees and adds to the negative environment, it is imperative that the Union comes in to protect employees rights.

pros: If you are a physician or an administrator I am sure it’s fine. Everybody else, good luck at the worst job of your life.
